I just read the article, , very interesting...especially the clip from the Congressional Hearing that stated stablecoins are strengthening the dollar

Thread detailing on how Strike uses Tether and the Bitcoin network to help countries like Argentina whose citizens don't have bank accounts
https://twitter.com/namcios/status/1481750090368929793?t=b6CimypBFA1i4xDzLeFJOA&s=19

Types of Stable Coins:
Collateralized (USDC, Tether, BUSD) - 1:1 peg with USD. 100% fully reserved (they're supposed to be, at least). 
Algorithmic (UST Luna) - 1:1 peg with USD in a funky way. Whenever new UST is made they burn Terra Luna. When people redeem/sell UST to get dollars, new Terra Luna is minted (ex). It works when you're in a bull market. As long as the market cap of Luna is bigger than the market cap of UST, it is properly backed/pegged. On how the Luna coin pumped then dumped and more:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1MgH01Ni6O0
